!_a.description: Returns the negation of a Boolean expression. This means true becomes false and vice versa.
!_a.example: The code private _isAlive = alive player; if (!_isAlive) then { hint "The player is dead!"; }; is the same as private _isAlive = alive player; if (not _isAlive) then { hint "The player is dead!"; };

-.description: Subtracts numbers or arrays from each another, negates a number. For arrays also see deleteAt and deleteRange.

a_!=_b.description: Returns whether one value is not equal to another. String comparison is case-insensitive (e.g "STRINGtext" != "stringTEXT" // returns false).
a_!=_b.example: if (_counter != 4) then { hint "The counter is not equal to the number 4"; }

a_%_b.description: Remainder of a divided by b.

a_*_b.description: Returns the value of a multiplied by b.

a_/_b.description: Returns the quotient of two numbers. If the divisor is 0 a Division by zero error is shown but the script does not stop and the result of such division is assumed to be 0.

a_=_b.description: Assigns the result of expression on the right to the variable on the left. Technically this is not a command and it is not listed in supportInfo; this is more of a compiler instruction.

a_==_b.description: Check if a is equal to b. String comparison is case-insensitive - use isEqualTo if case sensitivity is needed.
a_==_b.example: if (player == leader group player) then { hint "You are the leader of your group."; } else { hint "Someone else is the boss"; };

a_greater_b.description: Returns true if a is greater than b, else returns false.
a_greater_b.example: if (fuel truck1 > 0) then { hint "Truck1 has some fuel left."; };

a_greater=_b.description: Returns if a is greater than or equal to b.
a_greater=_b.example: if (fuel truck1 >= 0.5) then {hint "Truck1 has at least half a tank of fuel left."};

a_less_b.description: Returns if a is lesser than b.

a_less=_b.description: Returns true if a is less than or equal to b, else returns false.
a_less=_b.example: if (fuel truck1 <= 0) then {hint "Truck1 has no fuel left."}

a_or_b.description: Returns true only if one or both conditions are true. In case of the alternative syntax, lazy evaluation is used (if left operand is true, evaluation of the right side is skipped completely).

a_^_b.description: a raised to the power of b

abs.description: Returns absolute (positive) value of a real number.

accTime.description: Returns the current simulation acceleration factor.

acos.description: ArcCosine of a number, result in Degrees

action.description: Make a unit perform an action. See Category:Actions for action names and syntaxes.

addMagazine.description: Adds a magazine to a person. Infantry units can only carry a specific number of magazines, once the magazine slots are filled (or uniform/vest/bagpack are full in Arma 3), any further addMagazine commands are ignored. If class of magazine does not exist, an error message is printed in .rpt: player addMagazine "dasdsa"; // .rpt: Given magazine[dasdsa] not found)

addMagazineCargo.description: Add magazines to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Once the magazine cargo space is filled up, any further addMagazineCargo commands are ignored.

addRating.description: Add a number to the rating of a unit - negative values can be used to reduce the rating.

addScore.description: Adds a number to the score of a unit. Negative values will remove from the score.

addWeapon.description: Add a weapon to a unit. For a global version of this command see addWeaponGlobal. Infantry units can only carry a specific number of weapons, once the weapon slots are filled, any further addWeapon commands are ignored.

addWeaponCargo.description: Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Ignores available cargo space.

alive.description: Check if given vehicle/person/building is alive (i.e. not dead or destroyed).

allowDammage.description: Allow or prevent an object being damaged (or injured, or killed). The command does not prevent object from taking scripted damage such as setDamage or setHit.

allowFleeing.description: Sets the cowardice level (the lack of courage or bravery) of a group or unit.

allowGetIn.description: Set if the units given in the list are allowed to enter vehicles.

ammo.description: Check how many rounds are left in the currently loaded magazine in the given muzzle. Since Arma v1.56 the command also returns ammo for units in vehicles.
ammo.example: _count = player ammo "M16"; //returns 30 in case of a full magazine

and.description: Returns true only if both conditions are true. In case of the alternative syntax, lazy evaluation is used - if left operand is false, evaluation of the right side is ignored.
and.example: if ((not isNull player) and (alive player) and (_enemycount == 0)) then { hint "you win !"; };

asin.description: Arcsine of a number, result in Degrees.

assignAsCargo.description: Assign a unit as cargo of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order a unit to get in as cargo into a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the cargo space of the vehicle.

assignAsCommander.description: Assign a unit as commander of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as commander of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the commander place of the vehicle.

assignAsDriver.description: Assign a unit as driver of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as driver of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the driver place of the vehicle.

assignAsGunner.description: Assign a unit as gunner of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as gunner of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the gunner place of the vehicle.

atan2.description: ArcTangent of y/x. Used to determine the angle of a vector [x,y]. Result in Degrees between -180 and 180.

behaviour.description: Returns the behaviour of the individual unit, this is why it only accepts Object as the argument. For Arma 3 behaviour explanation see Arma_3_AI_Behavior

benchmark.description: Returns the value of "3D Performance" in OFP Preferences (flashpoint.cfg). This can be used to estimate the computer performance to adapt CPU and GPU demanding settings like view distance dynamically in missions.

buildingPos.description: Returns position of a given indexed position in a building.

cadetMode.description: Prior to Arma 3 it returns if the player is currently playing in cadet or veteran mode.

camCommand.description: Executes a command on the given camera / actor object. Known commands:

camCommit.description: Smoothly conduct the changes that were assigned to a camera within the given time. If the time is set to zero, the changes are done immediately. For camPrepareXXX commands use camCommitPrepared.
camCommit.example: SQS; create a camera object _cam = "camera" camCreate [5600,4800,10] _cam camSetTarget player _cam cameraEffect ["internal", "BACK"] _cam camCommit 0 ; smoothly move the camera to its new position in 6 seconds _cam camSetPos [5680,4720,20] _cam camCommit 6 @camCommitted _cam ; proceed

camCommitted.description: Checks if the conduction of the last camCommit call already finished.
camCommitted.example: SQS: ; create a camera object _cam = "camera" camCreate [5600,4800,10] _cam camSetTarget player _cam cameraEffect ["internal", "BACK"] _cam camCommit 0 ; smoothly move the camera to its new position in 6 seconds _cam camSetPos [5680,4720,20] _cam camCommit 6 @camCommitted _cam ; proceed

camCreate.description: Create a camera or a seagull object on the given position. The creation happens immediately and doesn't wait for camCommit.

camDestroy.description: Destroys camera object created with camCreate. This command doesn't need camCommit.

cameraEffect.description: Sets the given effect on the given camera. If you want to switch the screen directly to the first-person, aiming, third-person or group view of an object, use switchCamera instead. The effect type "Terminate" is used to exit the current camera view and switch back to the player's view. Does not need camCommit.

camSetBank.description: Sets camera bank angle. Does not commit changes.

camSetDir.description: Sets the orientation of the given camera in the direction of the given vector. Needs camCommit.
camSetDir.example: Since Arma 3:private _pos1 = player modelToWorld [0, 5, 5]; private _pos2 = player modelToWorld [0, 50, 50]; private _cam = "camera" camCreate _pos1; _cam cameraEffect ["INTERNAL", "BACK"]; _cam camSetPos _pos2; _cam camSetDir (_pos2 vectorFromTo _pos1); _cam camCommit 5; waitUntil { camCommitted _cam }; _cam camSetPos _pos1; _cam camCommit 5;

camSetDive.description: Sets camera dive angle. Does not commit changes.

camSetFov.description: Set the zoom level (Field Of View) of the given camera.

camSetFovRange.description: Set the zoom level (Field Of View) start and end values for automatical zooming.

camSetPos.description: Sets the position of the given camera or seagull (see camCreate). It is worth mentioning that camera position can also be set with setPos, in which case it would be instant. With camSetPos it is possible to make smooth position transition in time, defined with camCommit, which is required in this case.

camSetRelPos.description: Sets the position of the given camera relative to its target, set with camSetTarget. Needs a call to camCommit to be conducted.

camSetTarget.description: Set the target object or position where the given camera should point at. Needs the call of camCommit to be conducted. To reset the target use objNull.

canFire.description: Returns true if the given vehicle is still able to fire. For the command to return true, vehicle must be alive, have weapon operator and the weapon cannot be damaged ≥ 0.9 but can be empty due to running out of ammo. If mission starts with vehicle having no ammo or setVehicleAmmo 0 command is executed on the vehicle, then canFire will always report false for it.
canFire.example: if (not canFire _tank) then { player sideChat "Tank disabled!"; };

canMove.description: Returns if the given vehicle is still able to move.
canMove.example: if (not canMove _tank) then { player sideChat "He's nailed on the ground! Now hurry!"; };

canStand.description: Returns if the given soldier is able to stand up. It only checks for the unit's legs and not its alive/dead status - it can return true for a dead unit.
canStand.example: SQS: ? (not canStand player) : player groupChat "My legs! They hit my legs!"

captive.description: Returns the captive state of the given unit (set with setCaptive). A captive unit will not be attacked by its enemies.

civilian.description: Pre-defined variable for the civilian side.
civilian.example: SQS:?((side _unit) == civilian) : hint "This is a civilian unit!"

clearMagazineCargo.description: Remove all magazines from the given vehicle's magazine cargo space.

clearWeaponCargo.description: Remove all weapons from the given vehicle's weapon cargo space.

combatMode.description: Returns the combat mode of the given AI group. See setCombatMode for more information about combat modes.

commander.description: In Operation Flashpoint it returns the commander of a vehicle. Since Armed Assault it returns the primary observer. The commander of a vehicle can be found with effectiveCommander.

commandFire.description: Order the given unit to fire on the given target (via the radio). If the target is objNull, the unit is ordered to fire on its current target (set with doTarget or commandTarget).

commandFollow.description: Order the given unit(s) to follow another from his own group (via radio). It can also be used to resume unit formation after e.g doStop.

commandMove.description: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given location (via the radio). Exactly the same as doMove, except this command displays a radio message. The command will not put a visible waypoint marker unlike when move command is given via commanding menu.

commandStop.description: Order the given unit(s) to stop via radio. A stop command will never finish, the unit(s) will never be ready.

commandTarget.description: Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (via the radio). Command given to the player, puts a red square with words Target and Distance on player's HUD at target location. If player in vehicle and has radar facilities, it also adds target marker to the radar.

commandWatch.description: Orders the unit(s) to watch the given position or target (via the radio). Use objNull as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target.

cos.description: Cosine of a number, argument in degrees.

count.example: count [0, 0, 1, 2]; // returns 4 count units group player; // returns number of units in player group

countEnemy.description: Count how many units in the array are considered enemy to the given unit.

countFriendly.description: Count how many units in the array are considered friendly to the given unit.

countSide.description: Returns how many units in the given array belong to given side.

countType.description: Count how many objects in the array are of given type. This command also works with parent classes like "Air", "Tank", and "Car". For a full class reference see Classes.

countUnknown.description: Count how many units in the array are unknown to the given unit.

crew.description: Returns the crew (both dead and alive) of the given vehicle.

cutObj.description: Displays an object defined in the global config in CfgTitles.

cutRsc.description: Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's Description.ext, the campaign's description.ext or the global config.

cutText.description: Displays a text message in the center of the screen. The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "\n" new line characters:

dayTime.description: Returns the current in-game time in hours. For a formatted version of time, see BIS_fnc_timeToString.
dayTime.example: dayTime; // returns 16.5 given it is 16:30 (4.30pm) in game

debugLog.description: Dump argument type and value to debugging output.

deg.description: Converts given value in radians to degrees. 1 degree equals 0.01745 radians or pi / 180.

direction.description: Returns the direction an object or a location is facing (differs from getDir in that this also works with locations).

disableAI.description: Disables parts of the AI behaviour to get a better control over the actions of a unit. If the unit changes locality, this command might need to be executed again at the new locality to maintain effect.

disableUserInput.description: Disables or enables the keyboard and mouse input. Usually used during cutscenes.

distance.description: Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

doFire.description: Order the given unit(s) to fire on the given target (without radio messages). The target is set with doTarget or commandTarget. The target can be a unit or a vehicle, but not an object.

doFollow.description: Order the given unit(s) to follow another from his own group as his formation leader (without radio messages).

doMove.description: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given position (without radio messages). Upon reaching its destination, if it is the group leader it will order the group to form around it's new position. If it is not the leader, it will immediately be ordered to return to formation by the group leader and begin moving back to the group. Use doStop to stop units returning to formation. moveToCompleted will return true when a unit issued this command reaches its destination.

doStop.description: Order the given unit(s) to stop (without radio messages). The units stopped in this way will leave the groups formation. It will prevent them from moving around with their group (or formation leader), while still being able to turn around and even move to a new position if they see fit.

doTarget.description: Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (without radio messages).

doWatch.description: Order the given unit(s) to watch the given position or target (without radio messages). Use objNull as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target.
doWatch.example: _soldierOne doWatch markerPos "MarkerMoveOne" The unit named "soldierOne" will watch the position where the marker "MarkerMoveOne" is placed.

driver.description: Returns the driver of a vehicle.

east.description: Pre-defined variable for the eastern side.
east.example: SQS:?(side _unit == east) : hint "This is a eastern unit!"

enableEndDialog.description: Enables the execution of a custom camera sequence after the players death, coded in the script onPlayerKilled.sqs.

enableRadio.description: Enable and disable radio messages to be heard and shown in the left lower corner of the screen. This command can be helpful during cutscenes.

exec.description: Execute a script using (the deprecated but still available) SQS Syntax. SQF Syntax (and execVM) is the most recent scripting language.

exit.description: Stops the execution of a SQS script. It is ignored in SQF Scripts.
exit.example: SQS Syntax:? not alive player : exit

exp.description: Exponential function with the base e. Equal to e^x.

fadeMusic.description: Changes the current music volume to the given value smoothly within the given time.
fadeMusic.example: 5 fadeMusic 0; // fade current music volume to 0 in 5 sec

fadeRadio.description: Changes the radio volume smoothly within the given time.

fadeSound.description: Changes the sound volume smoothly within the given time.

fire.description: Forces a unit to fire the given weapon.

flag.description: Returns the original flag pole of the flag the unit is carrying.

flagOwner.description: Returns the global owner of a flag. A getter for setFlagOwner. Note that owner of a flag is Object rather than Number, as how it is usually with other owner commands

fleeing.description: Checks if a unit is fleeing.
fleeing.example: if (fleeing soldier_1) then {player sideChat "We have won!"} else {player sideChat "Keep fighting!"};

flyInHeight.description: Sets the flying altitude for aircraft relatively to the ground surface. Avoid too low altitudes, as helicopters and planes won't evade trees and obstacles on the ground. The default flying altitude is 100 meters.

forceEnd.description: Forces mission ending (set with endMission) even if a camera effect or any another condition delays the endMission (mostly in Operation Flashpoint).
forceEnd.example: forceEnd;// in an ending trigger to ensure no camera is delaying mission ending

forEach.description: Executes the given command(s) on every item of an Array or a HashMap.
forEach.example: // SQF { _x setDamage 1 } forEach units player; ; SQS "_x setDammage 1" forEach units player

format.description: Composes a string containing other variables or other variable types. Converts any variable type to a string. If you want to convert a string back to a number, use parseNumber.
format.example: format ["Player:%1, player's side:%2", player, side player]; // returns "Player:WEST 1-1-A:1 (Username), player's side:WEST"

formation.description: Returns the current formation of a group.

formLeader.description: Returns the formation leader of a given unit. This is often the same as the group leader, but not always, for example in cases when a unit is ordered to follow another unit.
formLeader.example: if (formLeader player != leader player) then { hint "The formation leader is different to the group leader!"; };

fuel.description: Checks how much fuel is left in the gas tank of a vehicle.
fuel.example: if (fuel vehicle player == 0) then {hint "The vehicle is out of fuel!"};

getDammage.description: Returns the object damage in the range from 0 to 1.

getDir.description: Returns the object heading in the range 0..360.

getPos.description: Returns object or location position. If the argument is an object, the return value is in format PositionAGLS.

globalChat.description: Types text to the global radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec)

globalRadio.description: Sends the audio message to the global radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

goto.description: Break script flow and go to given label (defined by # - NOT to be confused with SQF's hash sign!)
goto.example: goto "myLabel" player setDamage 1 #myLabel hint "you successfully avoided death!"

group.description: Returns the group a unit is assigned to.

groupChat.description: Types text to the group radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec)

groupRadio.description: Sends the audio message to the group radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol.

grpNull.description: A non-existing Group. To compare non-existent groups use isNull or isEqualTo:

gunner.description: Returns the gunner of a vehicle.

handsHit.description: Checks if a soldier's hands are hit, which results in inaccurate aiming.
handsHit.example: ? (handsHit player == 1) : player globalChat "Ouch! Don't shoot at my hands dammit!"

hasWeapon.description: Checks if a unit has the given weapon in hands or on back/in holster. Weapons inside unit containers such as vest and backpack are not counted.

hint.description: Outputs a hint message to the right of the screen (left of the screen in Operation Flashpoint) with a sound (except in Armed Assault). Use hintSilent for soundless hint. To split message in multiple lines either use Structured Text or \n (in lower case).
hint.example: // outputs the following: // Press W to move forward. // Press S to move backwards. hint "Press W to move forward.\nPress S to move backwards."

hintC.description: Displays a very basic message dialog in the center of the screen. Player control is taken away until "Continue" is pressed. The message dialog can be dragged around on the screen. After "Continue" has been pressed, the content of the hintC is repeated in a normal hint.

hintCadet.description: Shows a text hint only when in cadetMode. The text can contain several lines. \n is used to indicate the end of a line.

in.description: Checks whether value is in array, unit is in vehicle, position is inside location or ANSI string is part of other ANSI string. If Unicode support is desired, see forceUnicode.

inflame.description: Sets the state of a fireplace.

isNull.description: Checks whether the tested item is null.

knowsAbout.description: Checks if a group or a side knows about target.

leader.description: Returns the group leader for the given unit or group. For dead units, objNull is returned.

list.description: List of units that would activate given Trigger. It returns nothing before the simulation started, i.e. in (undelayed) init.sqf files. Returns a pointer to the trigger's list after the simulation started.

ln.description: Returns the natural logarithm of x.

local.description: Check if given unit is local on the computer in multiplayer games - see Multiplayer Scripting - Locality.
local.example: if (not local _unit) then { hint format ["%1 is remote", name _unit]; };

localize.description: Used to internationalize text messages. A string is returned from Stringtable.csv (or Stringtable.xml) which corresponds to the stringName.

lock.description: Lock vehicle (disable mounting / dismounting) for player. This command will remove user get in/get out actions but will not stop player getting into or out of vehicle via script commands (e.g moveInCargo).

locked.description: Check if vehicle is locked. If it is locked, Persons cannot mount / dismount without order.

lockWP.description: Disable switching to next waypoint (current waypoint will never complete while lockwp is used). Sometimes used during cut-scenes.

mod.description: Remainder of a divided by b.
mod.example: _remaining = 5 mod 2; // returns 1, as 5 divided by 2 is 2 × 2 + 1

move.description: Let group move to given position. Active waypoints will be ignored when command is used.

moveInCargo.description: Moves a unit into a vehicle cargo position (immediately and without animation).

moveInCommander.description: Move soldier into vehicle commander position (Immediate, no animation).

moveInDriver.description: Moves soldier into vehicle driver position (immediate, no animation).

moveInGunner.description: Move soldier into vehicle gunner position (Immediate, no animation).

musicVolume.description: Returns the current music volume (set by fadeMusic)

name.description: When argument is Object, the command returns the name given to a unit using the setIdentity instruction or selected randomly by the game engine if setIdentity has not been used on the unit. If used on vehicle, name of first crew member (in order commander, driver, gunner). If used on an object, "Error: No unit" is being returned.

nearestBuilding.description: Finds the nearest building to a given object or position. A "building" is defined as an object that is of class "House" and contains a path LOD.

nearestObject.description: Returns the nearest object of given type (or inherited classes) to given position within a sphere. Hardcoded radius is 50 meters. Unlike with nearestObjects, where distance is measured in 2D space, nearestObject will be closest object in 3D space.

nil.description: Nil value. This value can be used to undefine existing variables.

not.description: not a is exactly the same as ! a.

objNull.description: A non-existent Object. To compare non-existent objects use isNull or isEqualTo:
objNull.example: player == player; // false if player is null

objStatus.description: Sets the status of an objective that was defined in briefing.html. Status may be one of:
objStatus.example: "1" objStatus "DONE" Marks the objective named "OBJ_1" as completed.

or.description: Returns true if one or both conditions are true. In case of the alternative syntax, lazy evaluation is used. The means that if left operand is true, evaluation of the right side is skipped completely.
or.example: if (_obj1 or (_enemycount == 0) or (not alive _enemyGeneral)) then { hint "you win !"; };

orderGetIn.description: Force all units in the array to get in or out of their assigned vehicles. Units must be assigned to a vehicle before this command will do anything.

player.description: A person object controlled by user. In Intros and Outros this isn't set by default and must be assigned.

playMove.description: When used on a person, smooth transition to given move will be done.

playMusic.description: Plays music defined in Description.ext's CfgMusic or config.cpp. If the musicName could not be found a message is logged into the .rpt file: Music <musicName> not found.

playSound.description: Plays a sound from CfgSounds. Sound can be defined in missionConfigFile, configFile or campaignConfigFile.

private.description: Sets a variable to the innermost scope as demonstrated in Example 3. See also param and params.
private.example: private _varname = "this is my new variable"; // since Arma 3 v1.54 // identical, but less performant private "_varname"; _varname = "this is my new variable";

rad.description: Converts given value in degrees to radians. 1 radian equals 180 degrees divided by pi.

rating.description: Check unit rating. Rating is increased for killing enemies, decreased for killing friendlies (see Rating Values). Can be changed via addRating by the mission designer. The rating of the player is displayed as the "score" at the end of the mission. Via Description.ext one can define how many points it takes to get a perfect score, as well as the number of stars.

removeAllWeapons.description: Removes all weapons and magazines from the given unit. Does not remove items like map, compass, radio (see removeWeapon for this).

removeMagazines.description: Removes all magazines of given type from the unit. If magazine class does not exist, nothing happens, not even .rpt message, unlike with addMagazine command.

removeWeapon.description: Remove weapon from a unit. The unit must be local to the computer where command is executed. For a global version of this command see removeWeaponGlobal. Note: It is possible to create invalid combinations with this command (ie, attempting to remove a weapon that a unit does not possess). When doing so, application behaviour is undefined.

resistance.description: Pre-defined variable for the resistance side.
resistance.example: if (side _unit == resistance) then { hint "This is a resistance unit!"; };

reveal.description: Reveals a target to a group. If toWhom is a unit, unit's group is considered. If toWhom is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered. The knowledge value will be set to the highest level any unit of the revealing side has about the revealed target. If the revealing side has no knowledge about the revealed target, the value will be set to 1.
reveal.example: _soldierOne reveal _soldierTwo; // soldierOne knowsAbout information about soldierTwo is updated

saveGame.description: Autosaves the game (used for Retry). The saving is not started immediately, the request for autosave is made instead. To check the status of the request, use isSaving. The game can then be loaded from the last autosave with loadGame. Will not save if the player is null or dead.

say.description: Make unit say given sound. The sound is defined in CfgSounds. If the unit is a person, it will also perform corresponding lipsync effect provided an appropriate .lip file has been created for this sound.

score.description: Returns the person's score in MP.

select.description: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.
select.example: ["a", "b", "c", "d"] select 2; // result is "c" position player select 2; // result is Z coordinate of player position

setAccTime.description: Set simulation acceleration coefficient. May also be used to slow time in cutscenes.

setAmmoCargo.description: Set amount of ammo resources in cargo space of a rearm vehicle. Ammo resource is used to resupply vehicles that take ammo. Soldiers use individual magazines instead. Amount: 1 is full cargo. The

setBehaviour.description: Sets individual unit behaviour on every unit in a group.

setCaptive.description: Mark a unit as captive. If unit is a vehicle, commander is marked. A captive unit:
setCaptive.example: _soldier1 setCaptive true; side _soldier1; // returns civilian side group _soldier1; // returns e.g blufor

setCombatMode.description: Sets AI group combat mode (engagement rules). For individual unit's combat mode see setUnitCombatMode. Mode may be one of the following:

setDammage.description: Damages/hurts or repairs/heals object/unit. Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead.

setDir.description: Sets object heading. Angles are measured in degrees clockwise from north; the regular range goes from 0 to 360 (0° = N, 90° = E, 180° = S, 270° = W). Negative angles represent counter-clockwise angles.
setDir.example: myUnit setDir 45; // will set myUnit to face North-east

setFace.description: Set person's face. For a list of available faces, check Category:CfgIdentities.

setFaceAnimation.description: Sets facial animation phase (eye blinking), blink is in the range from 0 to 1.

setFlagOwner.description: Sets flag owner. When owner is set to objNull or any object other than a unit of class man or logic, flag is returned to the flagpole. A flag owned by a logic has no visual representation.

setFlagSide.description: Sets flag Side. A flag may be taken by any unit that is enemy to the side that owns the flag. Just like with setFlagTexture, if the command executed where unit is local effect of the command will be global and JIP compatible.

setFog.description: Smoothly change the fog over given time (in seconds). See also fogParams.

setFormDir.description: Sets group formation heading. Accepted heading range is 0 to 360. Formation is facing this direction unless enemy is seen. When group is moving, this value is overridden by movement direction. If the new direction is noticeably different from the old direction (approx +/- 15 degrees), units will change positions changing formationDirection.

setFuelCargo.description: Sets fuel amount in cargo space of refuel vehicles. Note that the carrying capacity of each side's refuel trucks differ.

setGroupId.description: Sets the group radio callsign, how it will be displayed in radio chat. Two groups on the same side cannot have the same callsign (possible on different sides) - see Example 4.
setGroupId.example: Arma 3:group player setGroupId ["Some name for the group"]; hint groupId group player; // "Some name for the group" player sideChat "lalala"; // Some name for the group (KK): "lalala"

setIdentity.description: Sets identity of a person. The identities could be defined in a custom config in Description.ext or in the main config. For a list of available main config values see CfgIdentities.

setMarkerPos.description: Moves the marker. If position is given in 3D format, z coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like createVehicle, createUnit, createAgent, createMine, setVehiclePosition for example. When Object is used for position, its getPosWorld is used.

setMarkerType.description: Sets marker type. Marker type is a class name from CfgMarkers.

setMimic.description: Sets person's facial expression. To set it back to default, use "".

setOvercast.description: Set overcast to given value smoothly during given time (in seconds). Zero time means immediate change. An overcast setting of zero means clear (sunny) weather, and one means storms and rain are very likely. Higher overcast values also result in higher wind speeds.

setPos.description: Sets object position to format PositionAGLS (over surface). The Z value is used to calculate the nearest surface below the provided position. If the surface is close, it uses the Z position of the surface. Otherwise, Z value becomes the offset from that surface.
setPos.example: player setPos [getPos player select 0, getPos player select 1, (getPos player select 2) +10]; // the same as above using modelToWorld (ArmA v1.00) player setPos (player modelToWorld [0,0,10]); // the same as above using vectorAdd (Arma 3 v1.22) player setPos (getPos player vectorAdd [0,0,10]);

setRadioMsg.description: Sets radio trigger menu title text (0 -> 0 -> map radio). Use "NULL" to disable radio slot. Use "" to restore default title
setRadioMsg.example: 1 setRadioMsg "Click meeeeeeeeee"; //changes title of radio Alpha

setRepairCargo.description: Set amount of repair resources in cargo space of repair vehicle. Amount 1 is full cargo.

setSpeedMode.description: Sets group speed mode. If unit is passed as param, unit's group is used. Mode may be one of:

setUnitPos.description: Set unit position rules. This command will not change the stance of the human player, even though it will change the output of unitPos command. To change player stance use playAction or playActionNow: player playAction "PlayerProne"; // DOWN player playAction "PlayerStand"; // UP player playAction "PlayerCrouch"; // MIDDLE

setViewDistance.description: Set rendering distance. Setting view distance to <= 0 resets the value to the client's options (set in Options → Video → General → Visibility → Overall).

showCinemaBorder.description: Forces drawing of cinema borders when using custom camera camCreate. This is normally used in cutscenes to indicate player has no control.

showCompass.description: Shows or hides the compass on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default true)

showGPS.description: Shows or hides the GPS receiver on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default false).

shownCompass.description: Checks if client has Compass enabled in description.ext (showCompass param) or force enabled with showCompass command.

shownGPS.description: Checks if client has GPS reciever enabled in description.ext (showGPS param) or force enabled with showGPS command.
shownGPS.example: if (shownGPS) then {hint "You have GPS reciever enabled"};

shownMap.description: Checks if client has Map enabled in description.ext (showMap param) or force enabled with showMap command.

shownPad.description: Checks if client has Notepad enabled.

shownRadio.description: Check if player has Radio enabled.

shownWarrant.description: Check if player has ID card enabled. Obsolete command.
shownWarrant.example: hint format ["Your ID is %1", ["off", "on"] select shownWarrant];

shownWatch.description: Checks if client has Watch enabled in description.ext (showWatch param) or force enabled with showWatch command.

showPad.description: Shows or hides the notebook on the map screen, if enabled for the mission. (default true). It is no longer relevant to Arma 2.

showRadio.description: Shows or hides the radio on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default true).

showWatch.description: Shows or hides the watch on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default true)

side.description: Returns the side of a unit, vehicle, object or location.
side.example: if (side player == west) then { hint "Player is on the West side" };

sideRadio.description: Sends the audio message to the side radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

skipTime.description: Jumps the specified number of hours forward or backward.

someAmmo.description: Check if unit has some ammo.
someAmmo.example: ? not (someAmmo _loon1) : hint "Loon1 is out of ammo!"

soundVolume.description: Returns the current sound volume (set by fadeSound).

speed.description: Object speed (in km/h). Returns relative speed of given object along Y axis. An equivalent to:

speedMode.description: Returns speed mode of the group, which can be any of the following:

stopped.description: Check if unit is stopped by stop command.

switchCamera.description: Switch camera to given vehicle / camera. Mode is one of:

switchLight.description: Controls whether a lamp is lit or not.

switchMove.description: Immediately applies given animation to the unit. For a smooth transition from the current animation, use playMove.

tan.description: Tangent of x, argument in Degrees.

textLog.description: Dump argument value to debugging output.

time.description: Returns time elapsed since mission started (in seconds). The value is different on each client. If you need unified time, use serverTime.
time.example: private _future = time + 30; waitUntil { time >= _future }; // continue after 30 seconds

titleObj.description: Shows object defined in global config in CfgTitles

titleRsc.description: Displays a resource defined in RscTitles. Also see cutRsc, with these two commands you can show two different resources at once.

titleText.description: Displays text across the screen. If used along with cutText two different texts (in different type styles) can be shown at once. The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "\n" new line characters (see Example 3).

true.example: _var = true; systemChat str _var; // true if (_var) then { hint "_var is true!"; };

unassignVehicle.description: Unassigns individual unit from a vehicle, i.e removes assignedVehicleRole of the unit. If the unit is currently in that vehicle, the group leader will issue an order to disembark.

unitReady.description: Check if the unit is ready. Unit is busy when it is given some command like move, until the command is finished.

units.description: Returns an array with all the units in the group or group of the unit.

vehicle.description: Vehicle in which given unit is mounted. If none, unit is returned. Alternatively, use objectParent
vehicle.example: SQS ? vehicle player != player : hint "Player is in a vehicle"

vehicleRadio.description: Sends the audio message to the vehicle radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

west.example: SQS:?((side _unit) == west) : hint "This is a western unit!"

createUnit.description: Create a unit of the provided CfgVehicles class.
createUnit.docSyntax: group createUnit [type, position, markers, placement, special]

createVehicle.description: Creates an empty object of given classname type. See Arma 3 Assets / Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles, or Category:CfgVehicles for earlier games.

deleteVehicle.description: Deletes an object. Only objects inserted in the mission editor and objects created during the game's progress can be deleted by this command. Island objects and player cannot be removed.

publicVariable.description: Reliably broadcasts missionNamespace variable and its current value to all computers (server/client).
publicVariable.example: TAG_MyPublicVariable = 0; TAG_MyPublicVariable = 1; publicVariable "TAG_MyPublicVariable"; // other clients will receive the "TAG_MyPublicVariable" variable with a 1 value TAG_MyPublicVariable = 2; // needs to be broadcast again - synchronisation is not automatic

sideChat.description: Types text to the side radio channel by the specified unit.

vehicleChat.description: Types text to the vehicle radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally, see remoteExec.
